intro: Hieracium sagittatum subsp. kvaenangense, commonly known as the Kvaenangen hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of northern Scandinavia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in open, moist habitats such as meadows and tundra. It is a perennial herb that produces a basal rosette of leaves and stems that grow upright. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of alpine and arctic flora.
